intro: Moquilea glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular moquilea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible parts. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically covered in fine, glandular hairs, which give it its scientific name. Moquilea glandulosa is often found in moist, rocky habitats and is adapted to the cooler climates of its native range.
